Learning involves making sense of new information. The best thing you can do for yourself is to try to make sense of new information by putting it into your own words and connecting it to what you already know.

Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

For questions 1 and 2, determine the number of solutions. Then solve the equation.

  1. \(3x^2=48\)

Correct!

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 8.3.1. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is two solutions; \(x=4\) and \(x=-4\).

  1. \((x+2)(x+2)=0\)

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 8.3.1 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is one solution; \(x=-2\).

For questions 3–10, solve the quadratic equation.

  1. \(4m^2=36\)

Correct!

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 8.3.2 and 8.3.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(m=3\) and \(m=-3\).

  1. \(d^2-25=0\)

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 8.3.2 and 8.3.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(d = 5\) and \(d = -5\).

  1. \(\frac{2}{3}z^2=54\)

Correct!

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 8.3.2 and 8.3.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(z=9\) and \(z=-9\).

  1. \(4p^2+10=266\)

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 8.3.2 and 8.3.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(p=8\) and \(p=-8\).

  1. \((a−7)^2+5=105\)

Correct!

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 8.3.3 and 8.3.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(a=17\) and \(a=-3\).

  1. \((b−1)^2−9=55\)

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 8.3.3 and 8.3.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(b =9\) and \(b=-7\).

  1. \(\frac17(x+3)^2−5=2\)

Correct!

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 8.3.3 and 8.3.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(x=4\) and \(x=-10\).

  1. \(5(x−8)^2−7=118\)

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 8.3.3 and 8.3.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(x=13\) and \(x=3\).
